result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor J Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 88 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Complete the Criminal Thinking Course. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. FIRST 2 months are Straight Time. NEXT 2 Months are with Huber. Release for work and treatment. LAST 8 Months are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determined with or without non-working hours.
To be completed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor J Hill

defendant.name: Hill, Trevor J
defendant.address: 515 West Moreland Blvd, Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Kegel advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Trevor J Hill in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  John Woodson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled at 3:18 p.m.  State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement.
Court finds defendant guilty.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

86 Days Credit - If Revoked


TERM OF PROBATION:  2.5  YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*Complete Criminal Thinking Course
*40 hours of Community Service

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME:  12 Months; First 2 months -STRAIGHT, next 2 months with Huber for work and/or treatment.  Last 8 months STAYED to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
